data.title: D2K wrong trike armament offset
data.body:
@abcdefg30 found this issue

Problem: Trikes damage walls in the cell behind it but only if the walls are positioned vertical (not horizontal) 

![screenshot - 2017-02-10 - 14 22 16](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20945684/22828242/78bb84aa-ef9c-11e6-80bd-3c84c88b850b.png)

First guess is that trikes have a wrong offset for its armament.
However, this will only happen to walls other buildings or units won't be effected.

----------------------
Edit 1: Yeah, offset is pretty off (:D)
- Trike: `LocalOffset: -416,0,0
` [LinkToLine](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/mods/d2k/rules/vehicles.yaml#L126)
- Raider Trike: `LocalOffset: 170,0,0`

Still I don't understand why this behavior is only triggered by walls...

data.title: [RA] Balance changes for next playtest/release.
data.body:
**Added values from pre-release1019 playtesting - Frame Limiter's (Mar-Sep, 2016) playtests and SoS playtests (v1-v1.42).**

**Allies Tech Center**
Health: 600HP, up from 400HP

**Flame Tower**
Projectile speed: 250, up from 204

**Light Tank (25mm)**
ReloadDelay: 22, up from 13 (+70%)
Damage: 27, up from 16 (+70%)
Damage vs Heavy: 45, up from 40
Damage vs Light: 110, up from 100
*Actual change with damage output: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/12739#issuecomment-279234199

**Mobile Radar Jammer**
Cost: $1100, up from $800
Custom build time: 22 seconds (default is 27 sec at $1100, 20 sec at $800)
Missile Jammer range: 5c, up from 4c
Radar Jammer range: 18c, up from 15c
Vision range: 7c, up from 6c
Cloak Detection range: 7c, up from 6c

**Mobile Gap Generator**
Custom build time: 24 seconds, down from 29 seconds

**Destroyer (Stinger, StingerAA)**
Missile range: 7c512, down from 9c
Missile tracking: 9c512, down from 10c819

**Paradrop**
Infantry drops with +1 Veterancy

- - - - - - - - -

**Added values as of Frame Limiter's (Mar-Sep, 2016) playtests and GAP Experimental build playtesting.**

**YAK**
Vision range: 11c, up from 10c

**MiG**
Vision range: 13c, up from 12c

- - - - - - - - -

- **Added values as of OMnom's TechCostEdit (v3 - v4.4) and RA Experimental build v2.0.**

**Barracks/Tent**
Health: 600HP, down from 800HP

- - - - - - - - -

- **Added values as of OMnom's MCVEdit (v1-v4.0) and RA Experimental build v2.0.**

**MCV**
Custom build time: 40 seconds, up from 32 seconds

- - - - - - - - - 

Comment: With exception to the MRJ and MGG the changes above has consistently provided for better games over periods of time. Values added from post-release1019 has the benefit of being tested by multiple community members and are represented in this PR as a lower common denominator.

It is of the opinion of this author that balance changes beyond these are natured more high-risk-high-reward and/or could benefit of being layered upon the above with future playtesting.

With regards to the Paradrop veterancy the code doesn't follow any known coding standards regarding added traits and new units (E1R1, E3R1).

- - - - - - - - - 

References:

GAP Experimental build: http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?t=19843
RA Experimental build v2.0-v2.2: http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?t=19886
OMnom's Playtest maps: http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?t=19877
SoS Playtest maps v1.5: http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?t=19944

data.title: Can't make deployed infantries turn
data.body:
Problem arises when trying to implemented RA2 style deploy and attack infantry.

While it is possible to make units fire alternative weapon when deployed,
the problem is they are not turreted: they have to turn to attack. With Mobile trait disabled when deployed, they can't turn! Alternative method would be to have a dummy turret which look like the deployed infantry.

Well, that happens in TS mod so I looked at tick tank.
Unfortunately, deployed infantries don't have WithVoxelTurrents, as they are sprites.
For tick tanks,  WithVoxelTurret plays well with AttackTurreted and AttackFrontal traits.
However, for infantries, WithSpriteTurret crashes the game horribly when I build the infantry:

```
		public WithSpriteTurret(Actor self, WithSpriteTurretInfo info)
			: base(info)
		{
			rs = self.Trait<RenderSprites>();
			body = self.Trait<BodyOrientation>();
			Attack = self.TraitOrDefault<AttackBase>();
			t = self.TraitsImplementing<Turreted>()
				.First(tt => tt.Name == info.Turret);
			arms = self.TraitsImplementing<Armament>()
				.Where(w => w.Info.Tu
```
Because both AttackTurreted and AttackFrontal provide AttackBase.

Actor fant has multiple traits of type `OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.AttackBase`

```
Over Powered Mod Mod at Version release-20170102
on map 9a0be9fc201c0fe99407e2a2962b66629fb7b2cc (Tournament Island by Scott_NZ).
Date: 2017-02-10 03:42:36Z
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.42000
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Actor fant has multiple traits of type `OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.AttackBase`
   위치: OpenRA.TraitDictionary.TraitContainer`1.GetOrDefault(UInt32 actor) 파일 D:\work\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\TraitDictionary.cs:줄 162
   위치: OpenRA.TraitDictionary.GetOrDefault[T](Actor actor) 파일 D:\work\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\TraitDictionary.cs:줄 95
   위치: OpenRA.Actor.TraitOrDefault[T]() 파일 D:\work\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Actor.cs:줄 252
   위치: OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.Render.WithSpriteTurret..ctor(Actor self, WithSpriteTurretInfo info)
   위치: OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.Render.WithSpriteTurretInfo.Create(ActorInitializer init)
   위치: OpenRA.Actor..ctor(World world, String name, TypeDictionary initDict) 파일 D:\work\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Actor.cs:줄 102
   위치: OpenRA.World.CreateActor(Boolean addToWorld, String name, TypeDictionary initDict) 파일 D:\work\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\World.cs:줄 250
   위치: OpenRA.World.CreateActor(String name, TypeDictionary initDict) 파일 D:\work\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\World.cs:줄 245
   위치: OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.Production.<>c__DisplayClass9_0.<DoProduction>b__0(World w)
   위치: OpenRA.World.Tick() 파일 D:\work\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\World.cs:줄 347
   위치: OpenRA.Game.InnerLogicTick(OrderManager orderManager) 파일 D:\work\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:줄 560
   위치: OpenRA.Game.LogicTick() 파일 D:\work\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:줄 585
   위치: OpenRA.Game.Loop() 파일 D:\work\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:줄 712
   위치: OpenRA.Game.Run() 파일 D:\work\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:줄 752
   위치: OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args) 파일 D:\work\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Support\Program.cs:줄 121
   위치: OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args) 파일 D:\work\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Support\Program.cs:줄 41
```

An alternative approach might be having two Mobile traits, where the other mobile trait has speed=0. That doesn't work as speed can't be 0. (induces div by 0 error).

Another way is to have the second mobile trait with really really slow speed but it doesn't work either since OpenRA engine can't cope with two Mobile traits. (Sounds like another problem as modders can't have units that speed boost as in RA3 Kirovs)

data.title: [RA] Add shadow to projectiles, alter armament offsets of Chrono Tank, Phase Transport
data.body:
Following up #12685 resolving conflicts after dependencies.

I also added a commit addressing https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/12685#issuecomment-277510924 as to give the Chrono and Phase vehicle armament height in order for them to be able to cast shadows as well. Incidentally I had way too much fun fiddling with the values and ended up with a different set for the Chrono Tank altogether as I found the firing animation to be lacking accuracy with its xyz offset:

This CTNK armament offset aims to make it appear as if the projectiles exists both barrels on its sides from all angles. The current animation makes it so that the exit appears flawed from certain angles and overall the projectile+blowback smog spawns way ahead of the side muzzles. Also the curve of the initial path of the projectile felt slightly exaggerated, clumsy and making the adjustment more difficult.

data.title: Savegame with one slot. Dump memory to file
data.body:
Solution for saving: Just dump whole memory that the game used to a file. When the gamer wants to resume, put the file back to the memory.
Saving is important for me, because i dont have the time to finish a combat in one evening. So for resuming is one slot enough. The file with the savegame takes up more space, but with one slot is it not a problem.

data.title: Savegame with one slot. Dump memory to file
data.body:
Solution for saving: Just dump whole memory that the game used to a file. When the gamer wants to resume, put the file back to the memory.
Saving is important for me, because i dont have the time to finish a combat in one evening. So for resuming is one slot enough. The file with the savegame takes up more space, but with one slot is it not a problem.

data.title: Hints
data.body: I do like if the computer gives me a hint while playing. Just what I have to do and what the AI player wants to do. A learning campaign would be great too.

data.title: AI can't handle RA3 Empire's Core style base building
D2K - Add Ordos Mission 1b
Minor removal of rules duplication in ts yaml
data.body: The main motivation was to remove the cloak from those old base buildings (as it looks bogus).

data.title: Fix GiveUnitCrateAction and SpawnMPUnits being limited to MobileInfo
data.body: You can now also spawn aircraft and crates.

data.title: Added Firestorm map Sunstroke
data.body: This adds the fine custom map from https://ppmforums.com/viewtopic.php?t=15379 to OpenRA. It has always been some kind of benchmark for me how far we progressed as it looked cool, but had many features we were lacking in the past: veins, high bridges, FS terrain tiles and atmospheric lighting. As you can see, almost everything could be ported. It is also a nice showcase on how you can change the light via Lua script.

data.title: Fix grenadier explodes trait
data.body:
Issue: #10114

Changes the grenadiers `Explodes:` trait to a more constant behavior.

Without PR:
- Weapon loaded -> Small explosion
- Weapon empty/unloaded -> Normal explosion

With PR:
- Weapon loaded -> Normal explosion
- Weapon empty/unloaded -> Normal explosion

 Ping @SoScared

data.title: ini Trigger to Lua Script converter
Fix rails in TS being invisible
data.body: Followup to #11904.

data.title: Mutant Hijacker is not engineer for vehicle
data.body: Mutant Hijacker need go out from the transport after death.

data.title: User commanded units will not reach target cell some times.
data.body: By sending a large group of units to a cell will cause **some of the units** to stop half way between ther starting positions and the targeted cell.

data.title: Group of units wont wait for other units to pass narrow paths
data.body:
In the original games sending a group of units to cross a bridge will cause the rest of the units to wait and not change direction to find an other way around.
exceptions are if there's a another path nearby such as 10 cells away or so.

the problem is that you basically lose half of your units that are trying to go to a completely different and long way out route forcing you to rage and buy a new screen... :p joke aside this is really annoying and bugged.following the steps of the original games on this will be a positive thing for the game.

data.title: Time to fix the annoying "training...tra...tra..tra...training" notification voice?
data.body: In red alert 2 sounds have a priority check and or a pause between sounds.for example you will not hear the same notification twice for some time,or an annoying training...tra...tra..tra...training voice...so isn't it the time to fix that for the sake of our ears and mental health?

data.title: Setup Wizard For New Mods
data.body:
Hi does setting up a new mod feels like a boring job to do? 
all this Packages map folders ect? how about a mod setup wizard with questions and staff?
an example will be: 
1) set mod name
2) mod dir (mix files,videos)
3) (Question) mod type (ra,ts,td,d2k,ra2,ect)
4) (Question) mod dependencies (like dll and mix files from other mods) 
5) ect ect.

So?

data.title: Stackable external condition duration cannot be reset by the source, a new instance will be applied instead.
data.body: This is a regression due to #8658 became undone during the upgrades->conditions rewrite.

data.title: BooleanExpression => ConditionExpression with integer values for token count comparisons
data.body:
This renames `BooleanExpression` => `ConditionExpression`, changes the underlying value type to `int` and uses the token count as the value of a condition.
This allows the following change
```yaml
RequiresCondition: condition-(n) && !condition-(n+1)
```
=>
```yaml
RequiresCondition: condition == (n)
```
reducing the number of conditions while keeping Boolean operations.

```yaml
GrantCondition@RANK-ELITE:
    RequiresCondition: rank-veteran >= 4
    Condition: rank-elite
```
is used to keep elite ranking decoupled from a specific rank.

data.title: SheetOverflowException exception message is bogus
data.body:
```
Exception of type `OpenRA.Graphics.SheetOverflowException`: Cross-sheet depth sprite reference: {0}.{1}: {2}
```

Repro case: start the TS mod with `Graphics.SheetSize=1024`.

data.title: Add stance support for AmbientSound
data.body: Currently `AmbientSound:`s are hearable for everyone.

data.title: Unhardcode properties in StrategicVictoryConditions and ConquestVictoryConditions.
data.body: A completion of #12643 based on #12387.
